definition: toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
peach
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
plum
surname Li

sentences.english: There are indications that the United States has probably reciprocated.
sentences.chinese: 有迹象显示，美国方面有可能投桃报李。

sentences.english: Chinese's good intentions, also obtained the foreign disability athlete's exchange of gifts between friends.
sentences.chinese: 中国人的善意，也得到了外国残疾运动员的投桃报李。

sentences.english: When you help others to succeed, they will do likewise for you.
sentences.chinese: 你帮别人取得成功，别人也会投桃报李。

definition: deeply grateful
lit. proper behavior is based on reciprocity (idiom)/fig. to return politeness for politeness
to do sb a favor at little cost
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
to kindly accept (an offering)
not to reciprocate is against etiquette (classical)/to respond in kind
pinyin: lai2 er2 bu4 wang3 fei1 li3 ye3

definition: lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to promise/to consent (to do sth)
to express goodwill/to be friendly
generous gifts
to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to give one's assent/to consent
wonderful/great/delightful/very kind/generous
